body:

``` Shell
make: *** [rfmod] Error 101
```
I would be surprised if those are at fault; the error should be coming from an explicit `as` expression that is casting from `*mut f32` to `f32`.

Yes, you're totally right. Error from this code :

``` Rust
extern "C" fn get_parameter_callback(dsp_state: *mut ffi::FMOD_DSP_STATE, index: c_int, value: *mut c_float, value_str: *mut c_char) -> fmod::Result {
...
value as f32
...
}
```

I didn't pay attention to value type... Big mistake ! Anyway, the error is reported, thanks !
Yeah, this is still something that should not be an ICE :) We should definitely be catching this during the typechecking phase inside `check_cast` in `typeck/check/mod.rs`.
